intro: Galium patagonicum, commonly known as Patagonian bedstraw, is a perennial herb native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its leaves are opposite and often have a hairy texture, while its fruit is a small, dry capsule. Galium patagonicum plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
